pros: Great patient outcomes, understanding leadership team
cons: Not much flexibility with hours

pros: Great team members, great patient populations to work with
cons: Burn out, overworked, low pay, work too many weekends/holidays, no weekend differential

pros: This was my first professional job in a different department and it was a great place to get started and work.
cons: I have no bad things to say from this employer.

review_title: One of the best in the Chicagoland area
pros: Great reputation that they've earned and lived up to.
cons: Northwestern culture may clashed at times.

pros: pay, teamwork, management, home/life balance, location
cons: short staffed at times, sometimes the nurse to patient ration is less than ideal.

job_title: Student Physical Therapist in Winston-Salem, NC
pros: nice people, flexible hours, supportive
cons: hospital things to keep track of

job_title: Clinical Informatics Nurse in Batavia, IL
pros: Small, cozy hospital. Great grounds to walk on during break (peaceful). Great staff, all who care about their patients.
cons: Management is corporate, and tend to cut people who have duplicate positions to other NM sites.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Wheaton, IL
pros: everyone is nice. Manager is reasonable. can pick your own schedule if you are registry. Lots of opportunity to pick up shifts if you are short
cons: nothing i can possibly think of. the work is physically strenouous. but thats about it. if you live far from wheaton then itll be a long commute.

pros: Great autonomy, team work and professionalism.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Physical Therapist in Crystal Lake, IL
pros: The team and resources are wonderful.
cons: Big changes with transition to Northwestern Medicine

pros: Nice people to work with
cons: None that I can recall

pros: great staff, great environment, learn about a healthcare environment
cons: gets repetitive and  patients can be mean

pros: the facility is clean and beautiful
cons: Terrible outdated training , unprofessional coworkers gossiping

job_title: Clinic Support Representative in Plainfield, IL
pros: Everyone involved in patient care is truly passionate about what they do. The providers are very caring and professional, and the nurses are a joy to work with. Beautiful campus.
cons: During my time there the clinic I was working at was being severely ignored. We would express our concerns and it would fall on deaf ears. Upper management does no evaluate or value good employees the way they should be. The off site offices are very small making it difficult for patients  to get through doorways with wheelchairs, which is extremely embarrassing since this is a rehab facility.

review_title: CNAs are dispensable here, do not apply!
job_title: CNA Or Rehab Care Assistant (RCA) in Wheaton, IL
pros: The facility itself is new and beautiful. On the surface, things look nice.
cons: Underneath the surface, nothing matters but money. The over hire nursing staff and then never give you the hours you're scheduled for. I am supposedly a full time night aid but I get cancelled 4 shifts out of ten. Also, they understaff us at night and patients suffer because we cannot take care of so many. I have been on the code blue team during several code blues in the last year. They were so poorly handled it was pathetic! Our staff is poorly trained for medical emergencies. My manager is more interested in making sure I take out the trash than in whether or not my patients are safe, clea and comfortable.

pros: Wonderful team work, very structured, very organized, had to proficiency out in all areas for improved expertise thru provided in-ouse modules.  Placed on teams under superviser of each team who was wonderful in the area of our intersest.   But could still get opportunities to work with other pt populatioons of your choice coordianted by dept.
cons: Alot of hard work physically but again supported by other Therapists as needed.

pros: It is a smaller facility that gives a sense of family & unity.  You get to work with your patients for a longer period of time, 2 weeks minimum, & have time to build ups relationship with them & their care. The campus and facility are both very beautiful.
cons: There are only 8 hour shifts offered: no 12 hour ones.   The range of exposure to different types of nursing skills are available, but very limited.

review_title: Not the Same Marianjoy - Stay Away from Working Here
pros: Our patients and fellow workers,
cons: See below. There is a lot.

pros: Coming from an Acute Care Hospital, I love the opportunity to see my patients' get better and return to their lives. Working in an acute hospital, my relationship with my patients was very brief, and I enjoy getting a chance to get to know my patients and see the progress they are making as they rehab their way back to recovery
cons: Management should look at overall performance, not one time small events

review_title: Respect and decency for patients, a very low ceiling to move upward. for eemployees
pros: Marianjoy has a lot of heart and everyone truly works hard to achieve their patients' goals in rehabilitation. Great cafeteria, beautiful campus and a pretty good pension plan.
cons: Very difficult to move upward and onward in the career chain. Director levels are not given keys to their division, and moving to that level calls for at least 10+ years of experience.

review_title: As a patient in 1990, and a volunteer in the last 15 years, I give it a THUMBS UP!
pros: How I see patients recover from such tragic things here, I think this place is sometimes a miracle work environment!
cons: I would like to work at Marianjoy PT or FT in the right fit for me, yet I have not had the opportunity yet!

job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Wheaton, IL
pros: Working with skilled staff in state of the art facility to provide multidisciplinary care with plenty of growth opportunities.
cons: Recent acquisition by Northwestern Medical, while further increasing professional growth opportunities,has resulted in rapid growth of caseload and inequitable rate of hiring staff.  This,along with poor documentation system, results in long hours to ensure professional documentation of care.

pros:
Family feel, easy to learn the management, friendly people. 
Management encourage growth and puts in effort to have you learn new skill sets.
cons: Outdated technology, and outdated practices. While the management does encourage growth there is not much growth opportunities. Very flat and mellow environment does not promote change.

pros: Overall MarianJoy is a good place to work.  The plus is that employee benefits begin after 30 days.
cons: When the census is low employees can expect being "called-off."  Since their has been a lot of changed in healthcare, this happens more times than expected.

pros: The people are all very helpful, a lot of clinical experience. The hospital has a new feel to it, it was just bought out by northwestern!
cons: Staffing can be an issue. Sometimes they are short and will ask you to work doubles.

job_title: Food Service Supervisor in Wheaton, IL
pros: Great benefits, tasks aren’t physically straining, food is delicious, staff is cooperative! The kitchen is very nice and well laid out.
cons: Short staffed very often, very strict on attendance. The employees are cooperative but have attitude issues. They struggle with change.

review_title: Save yourself grief and do not work here.
pros: Lovely campus on the outside but awful on the inside.
cons: Senior leadership keeps incompetent managers employed.

review_title: From young to older orthotic to prosthesis  to diabetic to left foot drop and research

cons: Northwestern Medicine recently acquired it. Lots of changes have been happening over the last 2 years but nothing really alarming.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Wheaton, IL
pros: Supportive staff. Excellent benefits.  Holistic care.

cons: The paperwork part seems frustrating to some employees, but I bet that is true everywhere.

pros: Management is supportive.  The associates provide excellent care. Staff stays because of the atmosphere.
cons: There are few opportunities for non-clinical associates to grow.  The benefits less than those of other area hospitals.

pros: Love working here, staff is super kind. Managers are great! Would definitely recommend! Great pay, great benefits, if I didn’t have to leave I never would.
cons: Staffing sucks sometimes but that’s an issue everywhere.
